node.title: Katy Perry's 'emotional response' to Australian designer aired in court battle
node.description: Singer Katy Perry's managerÂ says she was upset when she made disparaging remarks about an Australian clothes designer in emails revealed in court.
node.content:
["Singer Katy Perry referred to an Australian clothes designer who shares her name as a \"dumb b****\" in emails after sending legal letters demanding she withdraw a trademark application, a court has heard.", "Katie Taylor, the designer who sells clothes under her maiden name, Perry, has launched a case in the Federal Court, accusing her US namesake\u00a0of trademark infringement by selling branded clothing in Australia.", "The court heard the star's lawyers had sent Ms Taylor a cease and desist letter in June 2009, after becoming aware of her pending trademark application lodged the previous year.", "The designer went public with the dispute after receiving the legal letter and gave media interviews.", "Ms Perry's\u00a0manager, Steven Jensen, was today shown an email chain involving him, in which the singer made the comment about the designer.", "He told the judge it wasn't directed at Ms Taylor personally.", "\"Katy Perry is an artist,\" Mr Jensen said.", "\"Artists are emotional people. Emotions are what drive their talent.\u00a0", "\"That was an emotional response, not directed at Ms Taylor personally.\"", "", "
Katie Jane Taylor registered Katie Perry\u00a0as a trademark\u00a0in September 2008.(Supplied)
", "Mr Jensen said the singer was upset Ms Taylor appeared to be \"seeking publicity\".", "A second email from Ms Perry sent in July 2009 was titled \"this b**** won't stop\", which Mr Jensen accepted was a reference to Ms Taylor.", "Mr Jensen wrote to her claiming the issue had been \"blown way out of proportion\" and they were not attempting to have her cease trading under her name.", "He accepted that was a mistake because the letters did make demands.", "The letter, dated 19 June 2009, informed the designer her use of the trademark was \"misleading or deceptive\" and attached a draft application to the Supreme Court of Queensland.", "It warned of the possibility of filing an injunction and said Ms Taylor could be liable for damages as well as court costs \"likely to run into the vicinity of $50,000\".", "The letter required a response in four days.", "Mr Jensen told the court he didn't consider it threatening.", "\"I consider it a normal business approach,\" he said.", "The court heard there were discussions about putting out a statement to clarify the situation, but Perry's advice was \"keep me out of it entirely\" and issue a press release from management.", "\"Don't soften it up, don't apologise, nothing,\" were her instructions, the court heard.", "Attempts to draw up a deed of co-existence failed.", "Ms Perry, who will not appear as a witness, argues she uses her own name to sell branded clothing in Australia in good faith and has filed a cross-claim seeking to have Ms Taylor's trademark cancelled.", "The trial, before Justice Brigitte Markovic, is expected to run until Friday."]
